Header: Colombia grants citizenship to over 20,000 Venezuelan children
Content: Colombia announced that it will grant citizenship to more than 24,000 children of Venezuelan parents born in its territory since August 2015, a measure aimed at guaranteeing the fundamental rights of infants and avoid their stateless status. In addition to receiving citizenship, the measure, which will be active for two years, will guarantee that the children have access to health and education. More than 1.4 million Venezuelans fleeing the political, economic and social crisis in the oil nation are currently in Colombia.
